title: Can't open screwfix.com homepage
content:
Hello all

When I try to access screwfix.com from the uk, their address appears in the the tab but I get a blank screen instead of the homepage.

The same thing happens when accessing from a favourite (displayed on the FF opening page) or a listing from a search engine.

The website works as normal in SeaMonkey. I have restored the profile folder from a back up. I've turned off enhaced tracking protection for the site.

Any further suggestions please? TIA Dave

PS No viruses found by microsoft Defender

title: Disable onboarding prompt ("Open previous tabs?") FF 117
content:
We've recently migrated our Electron app to running a firefox kiosk application on our IoT devices. And one thing that has been happning is that this "Open previous tabs?" banner shows up after closing/reopening firefox. We've configured the following:

lockPref("browser.sessionstore.max_tabs_undo", 0); lockPref("browser.sessionstore.max_windows_undo", 0); lockPref("browser.sessionstore.max_resumed_crashes", 0); lockPref("browser.sessionstore.resume_from_crash", false); lockPref("browser.sessionstore.collect_session_storage", false); lockPref("browser.sessionstore.restore_on_demand", false);

But the banner (which seems to be for onboarding users) does still appear, does anyone know what preferences we are missing?
creator: niklas.andersson80

title: email problem
content: I can't get my emails. I keep getting a large box with this message. "Enter password for the account (my account name). Google requires completing authentication in your web browser". Underneath on the bottom left it says Cancel and on the bottom right it says Open Browser. When I click on Open Browser, as instructed, I get a smaller box with a wheel that just keeps going around. Under this smaller box on the left it says Cancel and to the right it says Open Safari. I do not use Safari. There is nowhere to click onto Firefox browser. Please help. Thank you.

title: Firefox interfering with computer accessibility feature:  mouse keys
content:
I often need to be able to use the arrow keys to navigate my screen, especially in order to find and click on browser links. However, in the latest version of Firefox on a new macOS Ventura machine, the arrow keys are interpreted by Firefox even though they shouldn't be; at the least corresponding box in "Settings" is unchecked.

How can toggle this behavior off?

Thank you, David Romano

title: FB diskuze na webu
content:
Dobrý den,

chtěla bych Vás požádat o pomoc. Na zkušební e-shop jsem si vložila FB diskuzi, která se v prohlížeči Chrome v pořádku zobrazuje, ale na Mozille ne. Je to nějakým nastavením a nebo sama Mozilla diskuzi blokuje? Zde zasílám odkaz na kterém mám diskuzi pod produktem vloženou.

https://www.webareal.cz/tynkaa/Aliquam-erat-volutpat-d57.htm

Předem děkuji za vyjádření či případnou pomoc.

S pozdravem Kristýna Kunciterová
creator: kunciterovak

title: Restore previous session not available / tabs from previous settings are not restored
content:
Dear Madam/Sir,

My computer had a crash today, after that windows was working on some updates. The firefox was updated also, I believe.

Since the updates, whenever the Firefox is closed and later opened again, the previous session is not restored. I have checked the General -> Start-up -> Open previous windows and tabs setting, and the option is ticked, (therefore it should do the session restore).

A have also tried "browser.sessionstore.resume_session_once" changing to "true" and that did not work either, so no previous tabs were restored.

Any ideas, what could have gone wrong and how to this this issue?
creator: edgarui

Thanks in advance

title: On the US Bank website (http://www.usbank.com/), there is a "cobrowse" feature that apparently uses javascript. It doesn't work with standard settings.
content:
"Cobrowse" on US Bank Website doesn't work, Using Firefox 117.0 (64-bit) for Ubuntu

On the US Bank website (http://www.usbank.com/), there is a "cobrowse" feature that apparently uses javascript. It doesn't work with standard settings.

Attempting to invoke it only gets a blue rectangle around the "cobrowse" link at the bottom left of the page, and displays "Javascript" in the lower left corner.

It should display a validation to allow the technician to follow and assist your actions on the site.

JavaScript is enabled.

I would like to use this feature.

title: View bookmarks with one click (i.e. from a top level interface control)
content:
View bookmarks with one click (i.e. from a top level interface control)

I would like to be able to view my bookmarks (not the toolbar) with one click and then open a bookmark with the second click. Is this possible?

The interface has top level controls for a promotional "feature" called "Pocket"; the extensions menu of all things; "toggle reader view" (which inexplicably opens some kind of FAQ page and which has forced me to retype this question by opening something else in the window instead of merely changing the display of the current window), and "list all tabs"—basically a bunch of features that I imagine very very very few people ever use. But no button for bookmarks? What am I missing?

title: 403 forbidden error when trying to sign in via Duo Security
content: I just reinstalled Windows 11 on my PC and Firefox along with it. I tried to access my school Outlook account on Firefox however I keep getting a 403 Forbidden error when it redirects me to Duo Security. Going back one page displays the error code "Authentication access denied" (also on Duo Security). I have tried: - Restarting my PC, both through windows and through a hard reset - Clearing my cache and cookies - using Troubleshooting mode - Allowing Firefox through my Windows firewall - disabling my firewall - changing networks This problem only appears in Firefox, as I am able to log in on Edge.

title: Can't log into my Proton Mail account when I'm in Firefox
content:
Hi -- I'm committed to Firefox as my browser, but I'm having a significant issue. I access my Proton Mail account from Firefox, but for a couple of weeks now I can't log into Proton Mail from Firefox. The browser won't even load the Proton Mail login page; it just spins and a message "Waiting for mail.proton.me" is visible in the lower corner of my Firefox screen.

Fortunately I can still access Proton Mail on my iPhone, but I need it on my Windows laptop too.

Please advise!
creator: knauth
